abstract: Potash Corp. of Saskatchewan, the Canadian firm attempting to fend off a $39 billion hostile takeover bid from BHP Billiton, said Thursday that third-quarter profits were $402.7 million, the second-highest ever, as prices for crop commodities rise.
snippet: Potash Corp. of Saskatchewan, the Canadian firm attempting to fend off a $39 billion hostile takeover bid from BHP Billiton, said Thursday that third-quarter profits were $402.7 million, the second-highest ever, as prices for crop commodities rise...
lead_paragraph: The Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, the Canadian company attempting to fend off a $39 billion hostile takeover bid from BHP Billiton, posted a third-quarter profit of $402.7 million on Thursday, its second-highest profit ever, on strong prices for crop commodities.

abstract: Analysts said that investors feared that the Canadian government would block a hostile bid for Potash by BHP Billiton.
snippet: Analysts said that investors feared that the Canadian government would block a hostile bid for Potash by BHP Billiton.
lead_paragraph: OTTAWA  Investors seem to be growing nervous about the future of the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan.

headline.main: Potash Shares Fall on Worries About BHP Deal
headline.print_headline: Potash Shares Fall on Worries About BHP Deal

abstract: Analysts said that investors feared that the Canadian government would block a hostile bid for Potash by BHP Billiton.
snippet: Analysts said that investors feared that the Canadian government would block a hostile bid for Potash by BHP Billiton.
lead_paragraph: Investors seem to be growing nervous about the future of the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, The New York Times reports.

headline.main: Worries Grow About BHP Deal for Potash
